steps.title: Find a mold.
steps.content: Find a mold. Your paver can be made in any shape or size. You can either create a mold yourself or use something from around the house like a tin pan or deep baking tray. Make sure the mold is at least 2" thick. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make your concrete mix by combining a ready-made mix, such as mortar or sand mix, and water.
steps.content: Make your concrete mix by combining a ready-made mix, such as mortar or sand mix, and water. Stir in enough water to create a consistency that is similar to a mud pie. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Spray your mold with non-stick cooking spray.
steps.content: Spray your mold with non-stick cooking spray. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the concrete mixture into the mold.
steps.content: Pour the concrete mixture into the mold. Start by pouring in the middle and move the mold around for even distribution. Make sure there are no bubbles. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove any access water with a paper towel or rag.
steps.content: Remove any access water with a paper towel or rag.

steps.title: Place decorations on the top.
steps.content: Place decorations on the top. This is an opportunity to showcase your personality so be as creative as you like. Some suggestions: sea glass, marbles, hand prints, initials.

steps.title: Remove the paver from the mold after it has dried for 48 hours.
steps.content: Remove the paver from the mold after it has dried for 48 hours. You should be able to turn it over and tap it out.

steps.title: Moisten and cover the paver.
steps.content: Moisten and cover the paver. Allow it to set for an additional two weeks.

steps.title: Place your paver in the ideal location and enjoy!
steps.content: Place your paver in the ideal location and enjoy! [5] X Research source
